DOC.detailed_description: Background Treatment statins class I indication percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) , often discontinue patient due side effect . Pharmacologic alternative show useful PCI include ezetimibe nutraceuticals ( i.e . compound derived food cholesterol lower action ) . It remain unknown , however , two therapeutic approach effective PCI . Purpose The primary objective study compare efficacy tolerability ezetimibe vs. nutraceutical-based protocol statin-intolerant patient treat percutaneous coronary intervention . Study Population Patients coronary artery disease stable condition treat percutaneous coronary intervention withdrawn statin treatment due side effect Randomization Patients randomize receive 6 month either ezetimibe ( 10 mg/day ) commercially available nutraceutical combine pill ( 1 capsule/day contain monacolin K 10 mg , policosanol 10 mg , phytosterols 300 mg ) .
